Sentencas: A stable bilayer electrolyte with high ionic conductivity was developed for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cell operation.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of high-conductivity bilayer electrolytes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The bilayer structure improved the limited thermodynamic stability of bismuth oxides and prevented electronic conductivity of ceria-based oxides in reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of high-conductivity bilayer electrolytes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Bilayer electrolytes were formed by depositing thin and thick layers of erbia-stabilized bismuth oxide (ESB) on samaria-doped ceria (SDC) substrates, via pulsed laser deposition and dip-coating techniques.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of high-conductivity bilayer electrolytes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Scanning electron microscope (SEM) images of the ESB/SDC samples showed dense ESB layers and excellent adherence between both ESB and SDC phases.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of high-conductivity bilayer electrolytes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Interdiffusion between the two phases was not detected by X-ray diffraction and EDX.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of high-conductivity bilayer electrolytes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Measurements of the conductivity of SDC coated with ESB exhibited slightly higher total conductance than SDC.
Titulo: Fabrication and characterization of high-conductivity bilayer electrolytes for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
